intro: Matisia putumayensis, commonly known as the Putumayo matisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, lowland forests and thrives in areas with high rainfall. The fruit is a small, smooth, yellowish drupe that contains several seeds.
